<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/11/more-than-20-countries-sign-pledge-to-cut-methane-emissions?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Other Greenhouse Gas
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/11/more-than-20-countries-sign-pledge-to-cut-methane-emissions?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Cows in a field" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/b42b2c49136af3cc1b334d24d1c18d14c396bf6c-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>PABLO PORCIUNCULA/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">25 more countries have <a href="https://www.axios.com/methane-emissions-cuts-pact-17131bbc-4485-4cba-a89e-e619f9740e7c.html?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pledged</a> to reduce methane emissions 30% by the end of the decade, US Special Climate Envoy John Kerry announced yesterday. That brings the total attendance at the methane slashing party to 34.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s progress, but also has a major asterisk. China, India, Russia, and Brazil, the four largest emitters of methane, haven’t signed on. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What is the relationship between methane and global warming?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s put it this way: If carbon dioxide is the Joker of climate change, methane is Harley Quinn. Methane is the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/11/climate/methane-global-climate.html?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">second-most prevalent greenhouse gas</a> to CO2, and while it lasts in the atmosphere for less time than carbon dioxide (~10 years vs. a CO2 molecule’s hundreds of years), it is a significantly more potent contributor to warming—about 28x more powerful, according to some estimates.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Therefore, climate experts say we won’t be able to limit warming without tackling the methane problem. Kerry said that reducing methane emissions was the “single fastest strategy” to keep temperatures 1.5 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">And where do methane emissions come from?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/10/11/world/global-methane-pledge-climate-intl/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Almost one-third</a> of methane emissions from human activity came from fossil fuel operations, according to the International Energy Agency. Methane is the main component of natural gas, and it can leak into the atmosphere from pipelines and other gas infrastructure. Other methane sources include landfills, erupting volcanoes, and decomposing veggies.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the No. 1 source of global methane is <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/73e5f1fc-76ac-48b0-871a-7fa4e8bda69b?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">agriculture</a>—primarily through livestock burping and manure. This has led to a rethinking of how dairy and beef cows are fed. One English farm is adding garlic and citrus pellets to cattle feed to disrupt methane-producing enzymes in their stomachs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>climate pledges will be the talk of the next few weeks as the COP 26 climate summit in Glasgow, Scotland, is set to begin Oct. 31.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/11/netflix-stands-behind-dave-chappelle-comedy-special?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Netflix Stands Behind Chappelle Special
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/11/netflix-stands-behind-dave-chappelle-comedy-special?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Billboard for Dave Chappelle's new standup special " The Closer"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/299a5042e7305ae5571d39ace38c39c2c62d02b2-1024x731.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>AaronP/Bauer-Griffin via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ted Sarandos, the co-CEO of Netflix, circulated a <a href="https://variety.com/2021/film/news/dave-chappelle-stand-up-netflix-controversy-1235086299/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">memo</a> to staff Friday in which he defended the company’s controversial decision to launch Dave Chappelle’s most recent standup special, <em>The Closer</em>, and offered guidance on how managers should respond to employees upset about the program, Variety reports.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some employees are angry because, in <em>The Closer</em>, Chappelle accuses the trans community of having “thin skin,” defends J.K. Rowling’s tweets that many have called transphobic, and calls himself “team TERF,” or a trans-exclusionary radical feminist.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Things got so heated that three employees crashed Netflix’s high-level quarterly business review meeting last Friday. One of those, a software engineer named Terra Field who identifies as queer and trans, <a href="https://twitter.com/RainofTerra/status/1445914236668895236?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bashed</a> the company on Twitter for airing Chappelle’s special. Netflix has suspended the three employees for allegedly attending a meeting they weren’t invited to. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the memo, Serandos said that Netflix doesn’t allow titles that “are designed to incite hate or violence, and we don’t believe <em>The Closer </em>crosses that line.” Others think it does. Jaclyn Moore, the trans co-showrunner of <em>Dear White People</em>, said she’s <a href="https://www.out.com/television/2021/10/07/trans-showrunner-says-goodbye-netflix-over-dave-chappelle-special?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cutting ties</a> with the company over its Chappelle decision. <em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<tr>

</a><span>  </span>
<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/11/prize-winning-economists-show-you-don-t-need-a-lab?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Prizewinning Economists Show You Don't Need a Lab
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The three Nobel Prize winners in economics show that science is happening all around us—if we’re willing to look.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">David Card, Joshua Angrist, and Guido Imbens, US-based economists who <a href="https://apnews.com/article/nobel-prizes-business-europe-3cbc672f994ae6f4f486a68b52c2bb32?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shared the prize</a> awarded yesterday, helped pioneer the use of “natural experiments” to conduct studies on real-life situations as if they had happened in a tightly controlled lab.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Here’s one example:</strong> Card is most famous for his and Alan Krueger’s <a href="https://www.nber.org/system/files/working_papers/w4509/w4509.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">1993 study</a> on the effects of minimum wage on employment. They compared fast food jobs in New Jersey, which had just raised its minimum wage from $4.25 to $5.05, to fast food restaurants in neighboring Pennsylvania. The idea was that NJ and PA are generally pretty similar, so any observed differences in the labor market could lead to important conclusions about raising the minimum wage.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What did they find? That NJ’s higher minimum wage did not hurt job growth...and may have even increased employment. This shocked most experts at the time.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Natural experiments are <a href="https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2021/10/the-credibility-revolution-1.html?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">now ubiquitous</a> in economics research, but only because these Nobel Prize recipients showed what was possible. —<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/11/key-performance-indicators-october-12?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/11/key-performance-indicators-october-12?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Cars stranded in floodwaters in the NYC area " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/91dc23a749bef8563b5fa1174e11560493a09629-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Spencer Platt/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>About a <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/10/11/weather/infrastructure-flood-risk-climate-first-street/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quarter</a> of US critical infrastructure—hospitals, airports, police stations, and more—are at risk of getting flooded to the point of being inoperable, according to a new study from the nonprofit First Street Foundation. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“We have no competing fighting chance against China in 15 to 20 years. Right now, it’s already a done deal; it is already over in my opinion.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nicolas Chaillan, the Pentagon’s first chief software officer, told the Financial Times that the US was <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/f939db9a-40af-4bd1-b67d-10492535f8e0?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">failing to respond</a> to China’s cyber threats and its growing capabilities in AI and machine learning. That’s the main reason why he resigned last week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Is Earth a giant crystal? (<a href="https://www.vice.com/en/article/z3xp85/is-the-earth-a-g-crystal?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Motherboard</a>)</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/11/private-jet-industry-struggles-to-keep-up-with-high-demand?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Private Jet Industry Is Taking Off
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One of the world’s largest business jet conventions kicks off today in Las Vegas. The talk of the trade show floor won’t be the best wax for buffing your G800, but the <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/aerospace-defense/business-jet-makers-look-tap-surging-corporate-travel-demand-las-vegas-air-show-2021-10-11?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">boom times</a> for private jets. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Private jet company NetJets said demand is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/01/private-jet-rage-grows-as-a-record-number-of-fliers-strain-the-system.html?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">higher than it’s ever been</a>, with an average of 500 chartered flights a day compared to less than 400 in 2019.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But that's also put unprecedented strain on the industry's infrastructure. If you’re already familiar with the private jet shortage, congrats on your lumber empire. But if you're not, you should know that that private jet operators are scrambling for workers and materials just like every other sector.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Private aviation company XO started requiring </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/01/your-money/private-jets-demand.html?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">72 hours notice</a></span><span> to charter a jet for its members, instead of the typical 24. </span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here: </strong>Southwest is struggling to get things back on track. It canceled 10% of its scheduled flights yesterday, after scrapping 28% of its Sunday flights. <em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

The Puzzle Section

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>Brain a little fuzzy after a long weekend? Kick it back into gear with <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/11/brew-mini-congress?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">today's puzzle</a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Marathon Trivia </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With the Boston Marathon held yesterday, we thought we’d devote this trivia section to the most famous marathons in the world, the six races known as the World Marathon Majors. Can you match the marathon with its unique characteristic?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Marathons: </strong>Boston, Chicago, London, New York, Tokyo, Berlin</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Characteristics:</strong></p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This one’s famous for its abundance of runners in costume.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Founded in 1897, it’s the oldest annual marathon in the world.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This city’s marathon updated its course in 1990.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The flattest of the Marathon Majors.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It finishes at The Mall.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This city’s marathon course incorporates five bridges.</span></li>
</ol>
</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<img alt="Brew's bookshelf promo image" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/e60e2caf77a1afa2bb2a60bc8d74300fa72c3f9d-1200x360.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every other week, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brew’s Bookshelf</a> brings you a few of our favorite reads.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Max Chafkin profiles the controversial tech mogul Peter Thiel in </span><span><em><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781984878533?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Contrarian</a>.</em></span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In May, the remains of 215 Indigenous children were found on the grounds of a former residential school in Canada. In 2017, journalist Tanya Talaga investigated seven deaths of indigenous students in Thunder Bay, Ontario, and the history of Canada's residential schools for </span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781487002268?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Seven Fallen Feathers</em></a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
</div>

target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epledged\u003c/a\u003e to reduce methane emissions 30% by the end of the decade, US Special Climate Envoy John Kerry announced yesterday. That brings the total attendance at the methane slashing party to 34.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s progress, but also has a major asterisk. China, India, Russia, and Brazil, the four largest emitters of methane, haven’t signed on. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat is the relationship between methane and global warming?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet’s put it this way: If carbon dioxide is the Joker of climate change, methane is Harley Quinn. Methane is the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/11/climate/methane-global-climate.html?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esecond-most prevalent greenhouse gas\u003c/a\u003e to CO2, and while it lasts in the atmosphere for less time than carbon dioxide (~10 years vs. a CO2 molecule’s hundreds of years), it is a significantly more potent contributor to warming—about 28x more powerful, according to some estimates.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTherefore, climate experts say we won’t be able to limit warming without tackling the methane problem. Kerry said that reducing methane emissions was the “single fastest strategy” to keep temperatures 1.5 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAnd where do methane emissions come from?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/10/11/world/global-methane-pledge-climate-intl/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAlmost one-third\u003c/a\u003e of methane emissions from human activity came from fossil fuel operations, according to the International Energy Agency. Methane is the main component of natural gas, and it can leak into the atmosphere from pipelines and other gas infrastructure. Other methane sources include landfills, erupting volcanoes, and decomposing veggies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut the No. 1 source of global methane is \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/73e5f1fc-76ac-48b0-871a-7fa4e8bda69b?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eagriculture\u003c/a\u003e—primarily through livestock burping and manure. This has led to a rethinking of how dairy and beef cows are fed. One English farm is adding garlic and citrus pellets to cattle feed to disrupt methane-producing enzymes in their stomachs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eclimate pledges will be the talk of the next few weeks as the COP 26 climate summit in Glasgow, Scotland, is set to begin Oct. 31.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTed Sarandos, the co-CEO of Netflix, circulated a \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2021/film/news/dave-chappelle-stand-up-netflix-controversy-1235086299/?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ememo\u003c/a\u003e to staff Friday in which he defended the company’s controversial decision to launch Dave Chappelle’s most recent standup special, \u003cem\u003eThe Closer\u003c/em\u003e, and offered guidance on how managers should respond to employees upset about the program, Variety reports.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome employees are angry because, in \u003cem\u003eThe Closer\u003c/em\u003e, Chappelle accuses the trans community of having “thin skin,” defends J.K. Rowling’s tweets that many have called transphobic, and calls himself “team TERF,” or a trans-exclusionary radical feminist.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThings got so heated that three employees crashed Netflix’s high-level quarterly business review meeting last Friday. One of those, a software engineer named Terra Field who identifies as queer and trans, \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/RainofTerra/status/1445914236668895236?s=20\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebashed\u003c/a\u003e the company on Twitter for airing Chappelle’s special. Netflix has suspended the three employees for allegedly attending a meeting they weren’t invited to. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the memo, Serandos said that Netflix doesn’t allow titles that “are designed to incite hate or violence, and we don’t believe \u003cem\u003eThe Closer \u003c/em\u003ecrosses that line.” Others think it does. Jaclyn Moore, the trans co-showrunner of \u003cem\u003eDear White People\u003c/em\u003e, said she’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.out.com/television/2021/10/07/trans-showrunner-says-goodbye-netflix-over-dave-chappelle-special?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecutting ties\u003c/a\u003e with the company over its Chappelle decision. style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nPrizewinning Economists Show You Don't Need a Lab \n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe three Nobel Prize winners in economics show that science is happening all around us—if we’re willing to look.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDavid Card, Joshua Angrist, and Guido Imbens, US-based economists who \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/nobel-prizes-business-europe-3cbc672f994ae6f4f486a68b52c2bb32?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshared the prize\u003c/a\u003e awarded yesterday, helped pioneer the use of “natural experiments” to conduct studies on real-life situations as if they had happened in a tightly controlled lab.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHere’s one example:\u003c/strong\u003e Card is most famous for his and Alan Krueger’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.nber.org/system/files/working_papers/w4509/w4509.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e1993 study\u003c/a\u003e on the effects of minimum wage on employment. They compared fast food jobs in New Jersey, which had just raised its minimum wage from $4.25 to $5.05, to fast food restaurants in neighboring Pennsylvania. The idea was that NJ and PA are generally pretty similar, so any observed differences in the labor market could lead to important conclusions about raising the minimum wage.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat did they find? That NJ’s higher minimum wage did not hurt job growth...and may have even increased employment. This shocked most experts at the time.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eNatural experiments are \u003ca href=\"https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2021/10/the-credibility-revolution-1.html?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enow ubiquitous\u003c/a\u003e in economics research, but only because these Nobel Prize recipients showed what was possible. —\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne of the world’s largest business jet conventions kicks off today in Las Vegas. The talk of the trade show floor won’t be the best wax for buffing your G800, but the \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/aerospace-defense/business-jet-makers-look-tap-surging-corporate-travel-demand-las-vegas-air-show-2021-10-11?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eboom times\u003c/a\u003e for private jets. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePrivate jet company NetJets said demand is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/01/private-jet-rage-grows-as-a-record-number-of-fliers-strain-the-system.html?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehigher than it’s ever been\u003c/a\u003e, with an average of 500 chartered flights a day compared to less than 400 in 2019.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut that's also put unprecedented strain on the industry's infrastructure. If you’re already familiar with the private jet shortage, congrats on your lumber empire.
